alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 03 at 6:05PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN WITH RISING STREAMS AND RIVERS THROUGH TOMORROW... An Atmospheric River will produce moderate to heavy precipitation across portions of northeast Oregon and southeast Washington starting after 10pm PDT tonight and persisting through Friday night. Heavy snow tonight will transition to moderate to heavy rain in the northern Blue Mountains before 8am PDT Friday morning, with rain rates diminishing Friday evening. Total liquid precipitation amounts through 11pm PDT Friday ranging from 0.50 to 1.25 inches are expected along the foothills, total amounts ranging from 1.25 to 3.5 inches are expected in the mountains with locally heavy amounts nearing 4 inches. This will lead to rises on area rivers and streams, with nuisance to minor flooding possible, especially along Mill Creek in Umatilla, OR and Walla Walla, WA counties. Ponding of water in low-lying areas and in areas of poor drainage can be expected. Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service for additional information.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains
